Summary: Large bright yellow light. First fading then changing to orange/red/black
divs: Sighting DetailsI had just arrived home after stopping at the store. My eyes were immediately drawn upward to a bright yellow light. It was in the same direction that most small planes travel from, but it was a different color, much brighter and about 10 times larger than the small plane lights and much MUCH higher. (large planes come from another direction) It was northwest of my location, about 3-5 miles above the earth. For about 2 minutes, I watched this bright yellow light (slightly increasing in intensity) in a stationary position. It started to slowly move southwest for about 1 minute. As it remained in this path, the yellow began to fade. It then turned to orange and changed (slight curve) to a northeast direction. It changed again to red and finally black. For about a minute, I watched a black oval slowly traveling east northeast and then it disappeared completely. Just vanished. It could have been due to the marine layer. I did not really think it was a plane due to the size and color. I had suspicions that it could have been a comet, but it had no tail. The change of direction made me question this as well. I logged onto the internet to see if there were any comets passing the earth, but one was only 53ft long and the other was millions of miles away. Recalling the Halebop comet, they looked nothing alike. Halebop was stationary while I watched it. It was fuzzy and had a tale. This appeared brighter, clearer and closer. That night was the first time in my 44 years that I actually thought I could have seen a "UFO"
Object Flight Path: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
